examples: A double helix of DNA is just 2 nanometers wide.

They pieced it all together to make the double helix model.
words.defineEn: the curved outer rim or outer part of the external ear

examples: It’s called the tragus.
words.defineEn: a small, triangular projection of cartilage located in front of the ear canal, partially covering its entrance

examples: These waves of air pressure enter our ear canals and bounce off the eardrum.

words.defineEn: the passage through which sound is carried from the outer ear to the tympanic membrane

examples: This double delivery fills the liver with nutrients, that it then sorts, processes and stores with the help of thousands of tiny internal processing plants, known as lobules.

words.defineEn: the soft, fleshy lower part of the external ear, often referred to as the earlobe

examples: One end of the malleus connects to the inner eardrum and moves back and forth when the drum vibrates.

words.defineEn: the small hammer-shaped bone in the middle ear that transmits sound vibrations from the eardrum to the inner ear

words.defineEn: a thin piece of skin in the middle ear that vibrates by sound waves and enables one to hear sounds, also known as tympanic membrane

examples: The other end is attached to the incus, which is also connected to the stapes.

words.defineEn: a small bone in the middle ear that helps transmit sound vibrations from the eardrum to the inner ear

words.defineVi: một xương nhỏ ở tai giữa của con người truyền các rung động âm thanh từ xương đe đến tai trong

examples: These are called auricles.

words.defineEn: the externally visible cartilaginous structure of the external ear
words.defineVi: cấu trúc sụn có thể nhìn thấy bên ngoài của tai ngoài

examples: Your cochlea is the part of your inner ear that converts sound waves into electrical signals, which then travel to your brain through the auditory nerve.

words.defineEn: the soft fleshy part of the external ear

examples: Each individual ampulla is connected to a tube foot.

examples: And every one of the canals widens at its base into sac-like structures, called the utricle and saccule, which are full of hair cells that sense the motion of the fluid.
